speaker: Customer
text: Half caff latte, please.

speaker: Waiter 1
text: [_shouts_] Half caff latte!

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Half caff latte!

speaker: Waiter 2
text: [_shouts_] Half caff latte!  [_A coffee is made and handed to the customer_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_now first in cue_] I rather like this new system, it's lively.

speaker: Waiter 1
text: Well, it's more efficient. What can I get for you?

speaker: Niles
text: I'll have a double shot, low fat, no foam latte.

speaker: Waiter 1
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, low fat, no foam latte!

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, non fat, low foam latte!

speaker: Waiter 2
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, non fat, no foam latte!

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, I think there was a problem in the chain of command, the middle person reversed part of it. She said, "A double shot, non fat, low foam latte".

speaker: Waiter 1
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, non fat, low foam latte!

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, non fat, low foam latte!

speaker: Waiter 2
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, non fat, no foam latte!

speaker: Niles
text: No, it happened again, that's not what I want.

speaker: Waiter 2
text: Well, you can tell her youself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waitress_] All right, I'll have a double shot, low fat, no foam latte.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, low fat, no foam latte.

speaker: Waiter 2
text: [_shouts_] Double shot, low fat, no foam latte. Nutmeg?

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Nutmeg?

speaker: Waiter 1
text: [_shouts_] Nutmeg?

speaker: Niles
text: No thanks. It inflames my stomach lining.

speaker: Waiter 1
text: [_shouts_] Inflames his stomach lining!

speaker: Waitress
text: [_shouts_] Inflames his stomach lining!

speaker: Waiter 2
text: [_shouts_] Inflames his stomach lining!

speaker: Niles
text: Stop that! [_Niles takes his coffee to his table as Frasier enters and sits with him. Frasier is weating a bulky red raincoat_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Welcome back. I trust you and Samantha had a pleasant weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, it was fabulous. We stayed at this gorgeous cabin just outside Aspen, we took a chopper every morning to the top of the mountain, God, I just didn't want it to end.

speaker: Niles
text: That would explain why you're still wearing that ridiculous jacket in an over heated cafe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, in Aspen they all wear them indoors. Oh, God, the funniest thing happened in the lodge last night. Jack Nicholson and Tom Brokaw discovered they were wearing exactly the same jacket. [_laughs_] So they staged a mock fight. Suddenly, Donna Karen flew between them pretending to referee, I laughed so hard I nearly spilled my toddy on someone named Puff Daddy.  [_The waitress comes over_]

speaker: Waitress
text: Can I get anything for you?

speaker: Niles
text: Just a dustpan and broom to sweep up some of these names!

speaker: Frasier
text: Cappucino, please.  [_Waitress goes back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, by the way, Niles. Do we have plans for tonight?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm afraid I have to cancel. It's my one month anniversary with Sam, I'd like to take her to L'escalias for dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: I understand, of course. One month is quite a milestone, thanks for the reminder - I need to change my water filter. [_sips coffee_] Damn, they put nutmeg on this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, speaking of Meg. Meg Ryan told me the most delightful story about practical joke Tony Hopkins played on Jodie at the ramp party for the "Lambs".

speaker: Niles
text: My stomach lining is just not going to get a break today, is it?!  **IT'S NOT YOU, IT'S ME... NO, IT'S YOU**  [_Scene Two - Restaurant. Frasier is sat at the table as Sam arrives_]

speaker: Sam
text: Look, I'm sorry I was late, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, no, no, that's all right. I took the liberty of ordering us the "Taste Of Monaco" dinner.

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, good choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: As I recall, that's what you ordered on our first date. Course, it wasn't food that you were craving that night. You whisked me away back to my place before the crab cakes could even arrive. You know, there's no better way to celebrate an anniversary than with a historical re-enactment. I've got my costume on underneath!

speaker: Sam
text: Actually, I'm really looking forward to those crab cakes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great, well, yes, yes, I suppose we should try the food here once. [_laughs_] Well, be sure to leave some room, you're bound to find a little Frasier-mint on your pillow when we get home! [_laughs_] By the way, thanks again for this weekend.

speaker: Sam
text: You're welcome.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's funny, I think it was a real turning point for us... well, for me.  You see, I was so relaxed!  At the beginning of relationships usually I-I'm very tentative. I just have this dark fear that I'm about to be cut loose. [_laughs_]

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I know, I know. I'm just being so insecure, it's nice to know that I'm on solid ground.

speaker: Sam
text: Um, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm standing on quicksand, aren't I?

speaker: Sam
text: I didn't want to talk about this until later...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Sam
text: I was just... It's not working out between the two of us. Now, it's not you, it's me. I just don't feel the same way about us anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: But things were going so well. What happened?

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, nothing happened. We had a wonderful time together, Frasier, it's just run its course. I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I'm sorry too.

speaker: Sam
text: I hope we can still be friends.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, I'd like that too. Well, you know, seeing as we're friends and all, I suppose there's no reason we shouldn't stay and enjoy what's sure to be a splendid meal.

speaker: Sam
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.  [_There is a eerie silence until the waiter arrives_]

speaker: Waiter
text: Your first course. [_puts them down_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, thank you. Tell me, how many more courses are there?

speaker: Waiter
text: Six, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Could you bring those all at once?  [_Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne and Martin are eating breakfast. Daphne is reading the newspaper_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Good Lord!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Look at this headline.  [_Daphne passes over the paper_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_reads_] "Martin Crane Dead". Wu-hu-oo! Bet you don't need much coffee after that! Gee, fifty eight, poor guy, hardly had a life.

speaker: Daphne
text: Handsome fellow, though.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, multi-millionaire, decorated war hero, wrote a spy novel. [_reads_] "Survived by his wife, Florence, former Miss. Washington and two sons, Joe, a Marine Corps colonel, and the professional baseball player, Mickey Crane". [_puts paper down_] Nothing like starting the day off jealous of a dead guy!  [_Frasier enters, wearing his lazy clothes, carrying a box_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello all. [_they greet him_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You were up and out early today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I thought like taking a walk. I've got a lot on my mind, I picked up some pastry. [_puts it down and sits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, whatever it is, you'll cheer up when you see these photos from your ski weekend. I admit, I took a peek. [_hands them over_] I must say, this Sam of yours is quite a catch. She's gorgeous, smart, stylish...

speaker: Frasier
text: We broke up last night! [_discards photos_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Orange juice, anyone?  [_Daphne exits to the kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that, Fras'.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's all right. It was a mutual decision. Well, a little more mutual on her part than mine. Once she dumped me, I jumped right on board. Anyway, I'll be fine, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's the spirit, just put it all behind you.  [_Daphne enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly. But I must admit, I'm having a little difficulty achieving closure. See, Sam said that her feelings changed for no reason! Can't help it might have been something specific about me!

speaker: Martin
text: Now, hold on, don't try to make this your fault!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, she's probably telling the truth. If a woman's trying to spare your feelings, she'll give you the old, "It's not you, it's me".

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly what she said!

speaker: Daphne
text: Waffles, anyone?  [_Daphne exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Now, you know, Fras', I know you're always looking for an explanation for everything but sometimes there isn't one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I know dad. It's gonna just drive me crazy. You know, until I know why it ended, I'll just assume it was any number of things about me. My self confidence will be shattered.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you've got two choices here. You can spend days trying to figure it out until it drives you nuts or you can do the smart thing, make a clean break, never talk to her again, and get on with your life.  [_There's a pause whilst Frasier considers this_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, dad, that's exactly what I should do. Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: No problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, sometimes you're very insightful.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I've been around the block a few times. [_pause_] So, when are you going to go talk to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right after my waffles.  [_Martin nods after knowing his son for so long as Frasier reads the paper_]  [_Scene Four - Outside The King's Crown Court. Frasier is sat on the steps reading his paper as Sam comes out of the building_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Sam, Sam, what are the chances?! You've found my thinking place!

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier, listen, I'm ten minutes late for a deposition.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we can walk and talk.

speaker: Sam
text: All right.  [_They start walking_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, you know, I'm loving this new arrangement of ours, I think we being friends thing is going to work out great.

speaker: Sam
text: Uh, listen, could you pick up the pace a little?  [_Sam starts walking faster, Frasier can barely keep up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. So, how've you been?

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier, I just saw you last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you did, and now that you bring up last night... God, you do walk fast... Er, I'm looking for a little clarification.

speaker: Sam
text: I told you this has nothing to do with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but it seems highly unlikely that such a sudden change could have nothing to do with me. I mean, maybe it is something that I did unintentionally. [_bumps into someone_] I'm sorry, my fault. [_moves on_] You know, something this weekend, maybe? I know I played the piano in the lounge a little too long but who knew General Schwartzkopf was so crazy for show tunes!

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier, there's nothing I'm not telling you. Sometimes things just end. Please, try to not take it so personally.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Sam
text: Right, I really am late, I'll talk to you soon, okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Take care.  [_Sam leaves as Frasier looks after her. He turns around and bumps into a man carrying some groceries_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Man
text: What's the matter with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's just it. I don't know!  [_End of Act One_]  [_Act Two_]  [_Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is searching the living room as Niles and Daphne are chatting_]

speaker: Niles
text: Where is Frasier? He knows we have "Berveda's", if you're late they give away your table and make you sit in the kitchen with the owner's mother.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell did I do with that remote? Daphne, are you sure you haven't seen it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Positive.

speaker: Martin
text: They ought to make one with a sensor on it. You get more than twenty feet from the TV, it senses it and starts beeping. Maybe for a deaf person they could make one that has purple smoke coming out of it like some kind of flare system or something.  [_Daphne suddenly holds Martin's face and stares him in the eyes_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, I'm begging you, you've got to get out of the house more!  [_Frasier then enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello all. Oh, Niles, what a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Niles
text: Just what Momma Bervada will say when we pull up a chair!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's right, dinner, I completely forgot. I took a long walk after work, I'm sorry, Niles. It must have completely slipped my mind.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, "Bervada's" out now. I take it you're still consumed with the Sam situation.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was just trying to figure out what happened.

speaker: Niles
text: The relationship ended, that's what happened.

speaker: Frasier
text: But there's got to be a reason!  [_Martin then enters with a broom and sits down. He starts to trying to change the channel with it_]

speaker: Niles
text: See, you're fixated.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not fixated! [_pointing at Martin_] That is fixated! Dad, what the hell are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, this is stupid! Maybe if I stick together ten chopsticks and put a rubber tip on the end for gripping.  [_Martin exits to the kitchen as the doorbell sounds. Frasier answers it to Roz_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll be ready in a sec, Roz.  [_Daphne leaves to her bedroom_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_calls_] Oh, it's all right, the movie doesn't start till eight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, that's right, I forgot you two had plans. Come on in, Roz. You know, I was wondering...

speaker: Roz
text: No! I don't know why Sam broke up with you, okay? Just like I didn't know two hours ago. Just like Gil and Bulldog and Miss. Judy from the Arts & Crafts hour didn't know!

speaker: Frasier
text: It never hurts to ask. Miss. Judy had some real insights before she had to make her popsicle stick run.  [_Martin enters from the kitchen as Daphne enters from her room_]

speaker: Martin
text: I think I'll go to Duke's, watch the game there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wait, wait, everybody, before you scatter. I'd like to ask an enormous favour. In the spirit of, well, self- improvement. I'd like you to tell me in your own words just what exactly about me you find unloveable.  [_The rest refuse and begin to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait! Wait, my God, it's really for the sake of our future relationships. I mean, it just, I know that you're afraid to hurt my feelings but I can stand a little constructive criticism. Now, come on, please, what do you think are my main faults?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let's start with what you're doing now. You analyse everything to death. Sam said it wasn't your fault but you keep digging around and digging around until you drive everybody nuts.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_writing in pad_] Okay. Dad thinks I am over analytical. That's great, we've got the ball rolling, okay, who's next? Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I'm not entirely sure how useful this exercise is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I don't care how you feel about it, you're going to participate!

speaker: Niles
text: Pushy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, if that's what it takes to... [_realises_] Oh, thank you. [_writes it_] All right, Daphne, it's your turn, don't be shy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if I had to choose, I'd say you are a bit of a fuss budget.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fuss budget! Well, listen, if you don't mind the substitution, I think maybe "demanding" is more the _mot juste._

speaker: Daphne
text: Pretentious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, you see, this is very good. Roz, you must have something?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you are a little full of yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great. Okay, pompous.

speaker: Roz
text: And you do tend to ramble on with the callers.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_writing_] A tad loquacious.

speaker: Martin
text: Pretentious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I all ready wrote that down.

speaker: Martin
text: Underline it!  [_Frasier writes it in_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, snippy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sarcastic.

speaker: Martin
text: Bossy.

speaker: Niles
text: Huffy.

speaker: Roz
text: Vain.  [_They all start talking to each other about how each one's true until Frasier stops them_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how nice we've finally found an activity we all enjoy together!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, Frasier, why don't you just admit what you're doing here. This isn't some "help-me-be-a-better-person" thing. You're trying to figure out what you can fix so you can win Sam back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now, Roz, that's proposterous.

speaker: Roz
text: Look who you're talking to! I've been down this road so many times, I call it "The Roz Expressway".

speaker: Niles
text: I've heard that phrase before but in a slightly different context.  [_Roz gives a sharp look as Niles goes off to pour a sherry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, maybe there is some truth in what you say, I mean, after all, Sam is really quite a catch, why wouldn't I want to get her back?

speaker: Roz
text: But you shouldn't change yourself just to please her. It's not healthy, and it doesn't work, and if it did, Steve Wilson would be my husband and not just some name tattoed on my butt!

speaker: Daphne
text: If you want my advice; the best thing you can do is nothing. Just leave her be to think about what she's missing out on.

speaker: Roz
text: I totally agree. No candy, no flowers and what ever you do, don't call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't see anything wrong with keeping the lines of communication open.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, you called didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe I left a carefully worded message.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier, you never call somebody who's broken up with you. It makes you look desperate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't have any choice, she wouldn't return any of my pagers! [_realises_] Oh God, I've blown it haven't I?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that depends. What did you say in your message?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, nothing undignified. Of course, tone of voice is everything, isn't it? You know, maybe I should just play them for you.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait, you have her access code for her answering machine?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, luckily I set it up with her. I gave her an access code that would be easy to remember - my birthday.

speaker: Martin
text: What's so easy about May 7th?

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't know, dad, my birthday's in March!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's right. The seventh, that's Eddie!  [_Frasier keys in the machine_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, okay, here we go. All right, now, listen and tell me if you think I sound desperate.  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Secretary
text: [_v.o_] Hi, Sam. Two quick things - dinner at L'escalias is not at 8:30 and the judge needs to see you at nine tomorrow morning and not ten. Bye.

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't get desperate, I got feminine!

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up, Niles!  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Hello, Sam, it's Frasier. Give me a call, if you get a chance. Bye.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't sound desperate at all.  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Hi, Sam, I forgot to mention I'll be at the office. Call me. It's Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe just a whiff of desperation.  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Hi, I'm at the office now.  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Still at the office.  [_The machine beeps_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] I stepped out to the coffee machine. Thought I might have missed you.

speaker: Niles
text: How quickly a whiff becomes a stench!  [_The machine beeps_]  [_Frasier's voice comes through the machine as he switches it off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, they just get worse after that.

speaker: Martin
text: There's more?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. [_presses button_] Not anymore though. There, messages erased.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, your messages were not the only ones on there. What about the one from her secretary about the meeting with the judge?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, you're right. That did sound important.

speaker: Roz
text: So, what are you going to do about it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess I could just call back and leave a message saying that I inadvertantly erased the message of hers while I was erasing a bunch of other messages that I left earlier.

speaker: Roz
text: With her secret access code!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realising_] Right! Oh, God, this is humiliating.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Frasier, I hate to appear unsupportive, but I've got to get to Duke's for the game.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, and we're going to be late for that movie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wait, I forgot my purse.  [_Daphne goes to get purse from kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry about it Frasier. You'll be fine, you'll bounce back. You're tough.

speaker: Roz
text: And resourceful.

speaker: Niles
text: Resilient.

speaker: Martin
text: Optimistic.

speaker: Niles
text: Tenacious.

speaker: Daphne
text: Conceited.

speaker: Martin
text: Different list, Daph'!  [_Daphne, Martin and Roz leave the apartment as Frasier sits at the table with Niles. He looks at the photos_]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to believe this picture was taken only three days ago. Look at us. How happy I was. Now, I'll never see her again.

speaker: Niles
text: Aren't you over dramatising? You're bound to run into her now and then.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I was talking about me and Lesley Stahl.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, looking at these photos, I can't help noticing there are very few of you and Sam together.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you getting at?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm just wondering how much you really feel for this woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't be ridiculous, I haven't felt this way for ages.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry. I guess I was wrong. It's love then.  [_Niles pours a sherry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know about love. We've only been seeing each other for a month.

speaker: Niles
text: But you could see yourself falling in love with her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Possibly.

speaker: Niles
text: Some time down the line?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, perhaps.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, no wonder you're heartbroken. You've just lost the only woman you could even possibly sometime down the line perhaps fall in love with. I'm surprised the country music people haven't jumped all over this one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, so I don't rhapsodise about her.

speaker: Niles
text: No, you did rhapsodise when she took you to "Le Cigare Volant" and you were seated in a secret VIP room we never knew existed.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you suggesting? That I'm so shallow I was with her mainly for her connections?

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't put it as harshly as that but let's face it, ever since we were young, you've had a yearning to run with the cool kids and it's never worked out for you. Your one day on the football team? The summer you bought that motorcycle. Although, to be accurate...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, it's only a moped if you pedal it and I never pedaled!

speaker: Niles
text: I just wonder if what you're mourning is not so much the loss of Sam, it's the loss of her celebrity lifestyle.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must admit things never did seem quite right between us. God, if it hadn't been for her friends, I probably would have broken it off myself. Oh, God, shame on me.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't punish yourself, Frasier. At least you're deep enough to realise you're shallow. [_pause_] Dinner?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: All though, I've still got to phone her about that message.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know what. Why don't we stop by "L'escalias" on our way to dinner. You can just run in and tell her in person.

speaker: Frasier
text: Even better! God, Niles, I can't tell you helpful this has been. Really, how can I ever repay you?

speaker: Niles
text: You can start by getting me into that VIP room in "Le Cigare Volant" - where is the entrance? [_guesses_] By the cigarette machine?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's just a decoy. It's through the dry cleaner's next door.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  [_Niles and Frasier exit_]  **IF IT'S BARBRA, I'LL KILL MYESLF**  [_Scene Two - Restaurant. Sam is sat at a table as Frasier enters to greet her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Sam.

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know you didn't expect to see me tonight.

speaker: Sam
text: Well, of course after all the messages, I'm not totally surprised.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, you heard them?

speaker: Sam
text: I checked my machine this afternoon. Frasier, I think we really need to talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, we don't. I promise you I will never call you again. I've thought about this and believe me you made the right decision.

speaker: Sam
text: No, no, I didn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Sam
text: Yes. Please, sit down. [_he does_] I was going to call you later anyway. You see, I think I figured out what happened between the two of us. I panicked. You see, I was starting to really care about you. I thought we might even have a future, even, and, well, it scared well. But the way you pursued me, showing up at the courthouse and leaving all of those messages and now you're here. Obviously, you feel just as strongly as I do. It's funny really. The both of us falling in love so fast and not realising the other one felt the same way. We should be laughing.  [_Frasier fakes a laugh and then tires_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, listen, Sam...

speaker: Sam
text: No, no, I'm going to tell you what we're going to be doing this weekend. We're taking the concord to London for a party at Alec Guiness' place.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not so sure that... [_realises_] Sir Alec Guiness?

speaker: Sam
text: Yes, well, I know it's a long way to go but Stephen is going to be there, he's promised to play some songs for the new one.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know... [_realises_] Stephen Sondheim?

speaker: Sam
text: Yes, oh, and you'll never guess who'll be singing with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cringes_] No, please don't tell me, please.

speaker: Sam
text: Frasier, what is it? You seem upset.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sam, I can't see you anymore.

speaker: Sam
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think you're an incredible woman but I've come to a realisation about us, well about me, and I just don't see any future for us. I know it sounds strange after the way I was pursuing you but I... I've been in it for all the wrong reasons.

speaker: Sam
text: Like what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not very proud of this, but maybe I was a little dazzled by the circle you travel in.

speaker: Sam
text: So you were with me just so you could be around some famous people?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not as though I wasn't fond of you as well.

speaker: Sam
text: Fond of me? Oh, well, thank you very much.

speaker: Frasier
text: But I understand that you're upset and I'm just gonna go.

speaker: Sam
text: I don't believe this... my friend!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know it's shallow and it's something I'm going to have to work on.  [_Lesley Stahl walks up behind them and greets Sam_]

speaker: Lesley
text: Hi, Sam, how are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_star struck_] Lesley, hello. Dr. Frasier Crane, we met this weekend.

speaker: Lesley
text: Oh, are how you?

speaker: Sam
text: What kind of sick bastard are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, we're just having a little bit of a spat. But, of course, I don't need to tell you, being the ace reporter that you are.

speaker: Sam
text: Just get out of here right now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right, okay. [_then to Leslie_] Listen, if you're in town for a while, maybe we can have lunch?

speaker: Sam
text: Get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: What is the matter with me?!  [_Frasier goes up onto the balcony and looks back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lesley. [_gestures towards her that he'll ring her_]  [_Sam throws a bread roll at him and he runs out, scared by himself_]  [_End of Act Two_]
